title: How to Make a Custom Music Mix (for Cheer or Dance)

steps.title: Get with the program.
steps.content: Get with the program. Download a music editing program. There are some great ones out there. Audacity is one that runs on Mac, PC, and Linux, and other operating systemsâ€”and it's free!

steps.title: Find a few different songs that go well together.
steps.content: Find a few different songs that go well together. Let your team members help pick the songs. Look for songs that have a similar beat or feel, or look for songs that are timed to the tempo of your routines.

steps.title: Open the songs in your sound editor.
steps.content: Open the songs in your sound editor. At the same time, create a new blank sound document. Find the pieces in each song that you want to use. Cut each piece, in order and place into the empty sound file.

steps.title: Add sound effects!
steps.content: Add sound effects ! You can buy CDs or download thousands of sound effects to add flavor to your cheer routine. Cut these and overlay them in various places of your music.

steps.title: Timing is everything!
steps.content: Timing is everything! Make sure the finished music meets your requirements. Listen through your mix with your teammates, and see what they think. After you do a couple of these, it'll be second nature!

steps.title: Burn to a CD
steps.content: Burn to a CD . Congratulations, you just made a great mix, and now it's time to use it. Make copies for your friends, pass them out, and get your team on the floor!
